snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said the United States had made significant headway in its drone campaign, which is hugely unpopular in Pakistan.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry, in interview on Pakistani television, says that United States has made significant headway in its drone campaign and that he hopes strikes in Pakistan could end shortly; his comments, and State Department's qualifying statement that end date is still unknown, illustrate difficulty Obama administration is having in trying to balance its desire to strengthen ties with Pakistan with its determination to strike militant groups there.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg and Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said the United States had made significant headway in its drone campaign, which is hugely unpopular in Pakistan.

headline.main: Kerry, in Pakistan, Expresses Optimism on Ending Drone Strikes Soon
headline.print_headline: Kerry, in Pakistan, Expresses Optimism on Ending Drone Strikes Soon

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
